website_summaries.verdict: The E-Fun Nextbook Flexx 9 is a budget-price detachable-hybrid Windows tablet with solid connectivity options and a bright, clear screen, but performance and battery life are lacking.
cons: Slow performance and short battery life in testing

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 4 years ago for my daughter for school. It's perfect for her. Works great and is light weight. I hook up a little mouse to it and she's good to use it. Battery lasts like normal. Update: there's not a lot of ram and memory. So it runs slow. I had to uninstall apps we don't use. The camera for her zoom meetings make the computer run slow and she gets booted.
customer_reviews.author: Kara LaMarca

customer_reviews.title: Pros attractive screen connected keyboard Cons (omg where to start) Heavy Screen hard to read native SSD very small (thus the sh
customer_reviews.text: Okay for the price. This is a windows 8 design with windows 10 shoehorned in. Pros attractive screen connected keyboard Cons (omg where to start) Heavy Screen hard to read native SSD very small (thus the shoehorn) extended memory can't be used for installed programs (but can run portable programs) Battery life very poor tendency to lock up (so far it has come back after forced shutdown) not very quick That being said, I use it to read ebooks, and connect with lending libraries. Soooo, for the price......
customer_reviews.author: Garry A.

customer_reviews.title: Not A Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I thought this tablet would be an excellent purchase, I was very wrong. I have used this tablet maybe 5 times since I purchased it in April, the internet will not stay connected, the camera has never worked properly, and I have never been able to get a hold of customer service, now the battery will no longer charge. It also comes with a limited time to return a defective piece of equipment, after reading the other reviews I see now that other buyers have experienced the same with this defective piece of limited technology.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best.. Have had it a couple months now
customer_reviews.text: Mediocre at best.. Have had it a couple months now. The internal mouse is the worst I have ever experienced and the touch screen is erratic. It is difficult to get the pointer where you want it to go and random windows constantly pop out from various corners of the screen. The screen sometimes starts shaking uncontrollably, requiring a reboot to stabilize it. An external mouse solves the bad pointer situation, but there appears to be no solution for erratic touch screen. But, it is functional and did not cost too much.
customer_reviews.author: Marc O Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Windows Device for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Best tablet-pc you can get for the price. Pros: -Touchscreen -Runs older games -Useful for academic purposes (Google Drive, Internet, etc.. work smoothly) -Decent battery life -Dropped a few times, and it still works -Easy to remove and reattach keyboard Cons: -Occasionally have to reconnect to internet (because I drop it from time to time perhaps?) -Smaller keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great mini laptop
customer_reviews.text: I'm not much of a "computer person" so I don't have any fancy jargon to throw around. This is literally a mini laptop. It runs just like a laptop, and has a curser, start menu, etc. It is small enough to fit in my purse. I telecommute for work, and needed something compact that I could carry when we travel, or when I go to doctor's appointments, etc. I love this thing and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Timberowl

customer_reviews.title: Internal Wireless Controller is Junk
customer_reviews.text: The device works to expectations when connected to internet, but internal wireless controller is junk and will disconnect from internet at even close ranges to wireless router. The disconnections happening at close range are at work and home so it's definitely the internal controller causing the problem. Main reason for purchase was to have a tablet to work "on the go", but due to continuously disconnections from internet, I leave it at home for glorified calculator...
customer_reviews.author: Bubs

customer_reviews.title: One bad trackpad quirk ruins everything good about it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this and it was so close to being the perfect little travel size laptop replacement, however my unit had this bizarre issue where the "share" sidebar charm would pop up by swiping down from the trackad. Since the trackpad is so small this action happens all the time. I did all I could to remove this action as an option, even hacking the registry. I could never remove the action and it made the tablet unusable with the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Another Dad

customer_reviews.title: Charging/Battery issues.
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this for a few months and already the battery charging has depleted. I have to keep it plugged in and not in use for 2 days to get it fully charged. I called the manufacturer directly and they wouldn't replace or fix because it was bought from a secondary seller (Amazon). The battery can't just be removed so I'm stuck. Save your money and buy a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed! Great product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: For less than $100 bucks! This little guy rocks! Don't waste your money on something that costs 4 times this amount, this Nextbook does it all. In addition, I added a memory card and downloaded 10 movies for even more fun. Solid construction, good processor, easy to use. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Neophyticus

customer_reviews.title: First I should say I am not a fan of ...
customer_reviews.text: First I should say I am not a fan of windows 10 which is no fault of the flexx, other than that its ok the rotation has stopped working all together when used as a tablet or a desktop this is very frustrating. at the end of the day always remember you get what you pay for. this is certainly the case here :-(
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Tablet works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Tablet works great for the price. I bought a mouse because the keyboard's touchpad is difficult to use. Two months after I bought the tablet, it wouldn't turn on. If this happens, hold the power button for 30 seconds to one minute and the device should power on. Worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: SAML

customer_reviews.title: This was horrible and I wish I never purchased this product
customer_reviews.text: This was horrible and I wish I never purchased this product. You get what you pay for, I guess. It's very cheap as a pro, but doesn't work as a con. (I'm sure you want this product to work when you buy it so)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this I got this for my mom to play ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this I got this for my mom to play brain games on to help sharpen her mind and keep it sharp although I must ambit I use it more then her I'm using it write now to write this review
customer_reviews.author: Mishamarquis87

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Only used this a couple weeks then it sat while I was gone for 6 months. Now it won't work and I had no success trying to ask for help at the POWERU site I bought it from. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: Had two of Nextbooks and had problems with both! The first one the keyboard did not work right and with the second it was acting sluggish and acting funny so I tried to refresh it and it crashed. The Nextbook people said that refreshing voided the warranty. No where in the book does it say that it would void the warranty. It does say that you have the option to keep files or clean the whole thing if you need to use the option. Bad product and extra bad service.
customer_reviews.author: Jcasey

customer_reviews.title: but did not like the fact it wouldn't allow me to open apps ...
customer_reviews.text: Its an okay notebook/tablet, has the same functions as a desktop and sincs with your desktop, but did not like the fact it wouldn't allow me to open apps in itunes or move the apps to main screen. It would be good for a young person wanting to try out a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Hillbillyhippie

customer_reviews.title: Just not functional...
customer_reviews.text: 1 GB RAM is not enough. Locks up a lot. Touch pad is erratic. Touch Screen is erratic. USB limited. Will not recognize external HD's Only Sticks. Won't recognize Canon Printer about half the time. Then when it does it won't print. Not enough ram. Wifi ok, Micro SD ok. But machine locks up constantly. Just not enough power built in to load browser and web pages well. Very erratic all round. Would not buy again. Best use is to put under a short table leg.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: for what i need, so far it is fast ...
customer_reviews.text: for what i need, so far it is fast and has tons of features, so far giving my home pc a run for it's money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it. No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this purchase. No complaints. I personally liked it without the keyboard. Unfortunately, I broke it. I miss my tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Shiryl

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this product. It didn't work properly. It required a software update but would get stuck in the process of completing the system upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy broke
customer_reviews.text: amazing for the price! but only 1 gigabyte of ram... glitches when a lot of windows are pulled up... wifi router broke after 9 months! (update) and now the keyboard randomly stopped working and nither does anything on the detatchable part! i eventually got the wifi to work but the problem was physical and it was the seller/and or nextbooks fault
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine if you don't expect a lot
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something cheap and small with low power consumption that I could just leave on forever. I only use this for 3d pringing and as a plex media server. It serves both of those functions beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Raybin

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. General use, but not recommended for high level user. No complex gaming or third party software Photoshop, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Nice purchase. My son definitely wants a bigger model though. The touch buttons and screen are a bit too sensitive also.
customer_reviews.author: HonestReviewsOnly

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is extremely heavy. Operating system is slow ...
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is extremely heavy. Operating system is slow and doesn't hold a charge for more then a couple of hours. I used this for less than a month before setting it aside permanently. My cellphone out processes this.
customer_reviews.author: brian j brockhouse

customer_reviews.title: For normally uses it might work great to travel with but not much beyond that
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with very much RAM which causes problems with specific apps and programs. For normally uses it might work great to travel with but not much beyond that. Good price for the product so it's an alright product.
customer_reviews.author: William Gordon

customer_reviews.title: We like these, but i'm dissapointed in trying to open ...
customer_reviews.text: We like these, but i'm dissapointed in trying to open up a new screen. It seems to be a bit of a challenge, and I wish the keyboard was lit up for evening use.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my grand daughter and she loves it very ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my grand daughter and she loves it very much. Amazing that it's got Win10 on it. but needed to get the extra gigs for memory. Did not come with any memory card.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia L

customer_reviews.title: as soon as u update there no more space to ...
customer_reviews.text: as soon as u update there no more space to do anything and it slows to a crawl and freezes up
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Augustyniak

customer_reviews.title: It will be great for my upcoming trip to France
customer_reviews.text: Impressive it does everything I need it to do. With Windows 10 it can run Skype, puttynd 3.1, .pdf reader, and it also has Word and Excel installed. Light weight and powerful. It will be great for my upcoming trip to France!
customer_reviews.author: Brian L. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: don't bother with this one
customer_reviews.text: not very happy with it. Freezes often and it's very slow. I don't do any gaming, so I don't know how it does w/ that, but if it's slow loading emails, and changing websites, I can't imagine it would handle games
customer_reviews.author: Kay S

customer_reviews.title: ... was a work around and the unit still works great other than having to use two buttons instead of ...
customer_reviews.text: The On Switch quit working in the first 3 days but there was a work around and the unit still works great other than having to use two buttons instead of the one I should have to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: loved it! just didn't do what I needed it to do!
customer_reviews.author: ladyg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for reading books and web browsing
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tablet that runs Windows 10. I was primarily looking for something for reading and light web browsing for when I go on trips. This is perfect for what I wanted at a really good price. Only bummers for me is that it doesn't recognize my 128gb usb 3.0 drive but it does recognize my 16gb 2.0 drive and will play video off it. The other thing is the fact that you can't recharge from the usb port and must use the included charger. If you're looking for power look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: it worked really well for the first 2 weeks and then it started to loose its charge really quickly. Eventually it just wasn't able to hold enough charge to even turn on, even if it was plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Faith T.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard and mouse do not work, none of the hot keys work even though they are labeled and the mouse is a nightmare, the screen is cracking around the edges because the plastic case is too cheap to hold the glass in one place
customer_reviews.author: Evanwade6

customer_reviews.title: My nextbook 9
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. He uses it for his work and the customers can pay right from his Nextbook (you must buy the card scanner). it's lightweight and very cool
customer_reviews.author: mommy

customer_reviews.title: I have like using this little computer
customer_reviews.text: I have like using this little computer. It's small size makes an easy access to email and internet. Great value. A lot of computer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Parker

customer_reviews.title: HARD TO USE
customer_reviews.text: It has windows 10 which did not function correctly. Also, it is hard to remove the screen.
customer_reviews.author: DRJPPJR

customer_reviews.title: Get it.
customer_reviews.text: It's not for people that enjoy graphically intensive computer activities, but if you just want to browse the internet and watch movies on planes, it's hard to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: ... learning how to do things but so far so good. I am happy with
customer_reviews.text: Still learning how to do things but so far so good. I am happy with it

customer_reviews.title: very good take with you to

customer_reviews.title: Works Well With Windows PC
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband as he has a Windows PC and an Android tablet but kept having compatibility problems between the two. He is very happy to now have a Windows tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Williams

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It only has 1GB of ram but I only use it to surf the web and apply for jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Elais L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, although I imagined it a little bigger and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, although I imagined it a little bigger and that you could adjust the angle of the keyboard- other than that. Great price for technology!
customer_reviews.author: ved90

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it is good. I don't like the new software but it ...
customer_reviews.text: It meets my expectations except for one small but irritating detail - the cursor moves independently and I find myself typing on a different line. Otherwise it is good. I don't like the new software but it may just take getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: DDW

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet and comes with Windows 10.  Updated 4/21/16 - not so happy now
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little tablet and i like the keyboard. This is my first experience with Windows 10 and although I prefer Windows 7 you can make it work the same as the older version. The only issue is the touchscreen does not always work as expected. Since I do not have any experience with touch screen devices it is probably my lack of experience. I can still get to the things I need. Update: I spoke too soon. This thing locked up and rebooting doesn't help. Tried a reset which never finished. I never loaded any apps, just wanted it to check email on the web. Guess it's true...you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: carolinagirl

customer_reviews.title: This is great for a secondary computer laptop to handle the small ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great for a secondary computer laptop to handle the small things so your primary desktop/laptop can have all its resources to do the heavier work undisturbed. Not all that great on its own since the 1GB ram will quickly be suffocated with only 2 tabs of websites full of Java apps. Still a reliable device for my college ebooks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little device that allows me to work as if I were in my office!

customer_reviews.title: Very nice! Still getting used to controls
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! Still getting used to controls. When I swipe with the mouse to the right, page sometimes minimizes. Otherwise great device and low price!

customer_reviews.title: It's a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I read about what is said about other buyers. I wish I read them before buying it. I've USB problem & power plug to socket connection problem. Bought it with high hopes only to be highly disappointed. Wasted almost a day taking to customer service, rebooting & updating it.

customer_reviews.title: But it does everything I want it to do which is mostly apps like facebook, netflix
customer_reviews.text: It's smaller than I thought it would be, 8.9 inches is not a lot. But it does everything I want it to do which is mostly apps like facebook, netflix, and a few games.

If you need a small lap top for work or study - this is not the one. Windows 10 is like other MS products - messy. Android products and OS win hands down. My error buying - will return.

product_meta.title: Nextbook Flexx 9 Touchscreen 8.9" Intel Quad Core 2-in-1 Tablet 32GB with Detachable Keyboard Windows 10 - Black
product_meta.description: The Nextbook Flexx 9 2-in-1 tablet is everything you want in a Windows 10 portable device. It's ultra-fast, with an 8.9-inch high-resolution (1280x800) IPS display and a detachable foldable POGO keyboard with a standard USB 2.0 port. This new Nextbook Flexx 9 comes with a Quad-Core Intel Atom-based processor for optimal performance and the latest Microsoft Windows 10 OS. Touch, click or type — you choose what fits your style and activity. All the great apps you need are in the Windows Store; plus, you can play Xbox games, music and videos. With 32GB of internal memory and the option to expand via microSD slot to 64GB more, storage is not an issue. Use Skype to video chat, take notes with Office, and get your photos and files from anywhere with OneDrive. This Nextbook Flexx includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OneNote apps, optimized for the small screen and designed for work on the go.
feature_bullets: This refurbished product is tested and certified to look and work like new. The refurbishing process includes functionality testing, basic cleaning, inspection, and repackaging. The product ships with all relevant accessories, and may arrive in a generic box
